concise_definition: n. 昨天, 前天; adv. 昨天

definitions.explanation_en: The day immediately before today; the most recent completed day in the calendar sequence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指今天之前的那一天，即日历序列中最近已完成的一天。
definitions.example_en: I finished reading the book yesterday.

definitions.explanation_en: Used to indicate that an action or event occurred on the day before today.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于表示某个动作或事件发生在今天之前的一天。
definitions.example_en: She called me yesterday to apologize.

definitions.explanation_en: A figurative reference to a past time, often implying a time that is now gone or no longer relevant, especially in contrast to the present.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻性地指过去的一个时期，常暗示那个时期已不复存在或与现在形成对比。
definitions.example_en: The technology of yesterday can't compete with today's innovations.
definitions.example_cn: 昨天的技术无法与今天的创新相媲美。

comparison.analysis: “Today” (今天) 指当前正在经历的这一天，与 “yesterday” 形成时间上的直接对立。前者强调当下，后者强调刚过去的过去。两者常用于对比现状与先前状态，如 “Today is different from yesterday.”
“Tomorrow” (明天) 指即将到来的那一天，与 “yesterday” 构成时间轴上的两端：一个代表过去，一个代表未来。它们常被用来表达变化或期望，如 “What happened yesterday will shape tomorrow.”
“Last night” (昨晚) 仅指昨天夜晚这一具体时段，而 “yesterday” 指全天（从午夜到午夜）。前者是时间片段，后者是完整日期单位。例如：'I saw the movie last night'（昨晚）vs. 'I finished the project yesterday'（昨天一整天）。
